snippet: A veteran New York City police officer disappeared for two days with tens of thousands of dollars intended for him and colleagues to travel for a Giants football game, the police and a person familiar with the matter said.
abstract: New York City Police Officer Elisha Duncan, who disappeared for two days with tens of thousands of dollars intended for him and group of his colleagues to travel to Seattle for New York Giants football game, is found unharmed in his car in the Bronx; it remains unclear whether the money has been recovered and whether Duncan will face criminal charges.

byline.original: By ASHLEY SOUTHALL and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM

lead_paragraph: A veteran New York City police officer disappeared for two days with tens of thousands of dollars intended for him and colleagues to travel for a Giants football game, the police and a person familiar with the matter said.

headline.main: New York Police Officer Found After Vanishing With Money
headline.print_headline: Officer Found After Vanishing With Money
